ml_predictor module

Machine Learning predictor module for anomaly detection with Random Forest.

class ml_predictor.MLPredictor(model_path: str, scaler_path: str, encoder_path: str, threshold: float = 0.7)[source]

Bases: object

ML predictor for network intrusion detection using Random Forest.

model

Trained RandomForest model.

scaler

StandardScaler for feature normalization.

label_encoder

LabelEncoder for attack type decoding.

threshold

Anomaly detection threshold.

metadata

Model metadata including feature names.

n_features_expected

Expected number of features.

get_feature_importance(top_n: int = 20) → Dict[str, float][source]

Get feature importance from RandomForest model.

Parameters:

top_n – Number of top features to return.

Returns:

Dictionary of feature names and importance scores.

get_model_info() → Dict[str, Any][source]

Get information about the loaded model.

Returns:

Dictionary with model information.

predict(features: list) → Tuple[str, float, str, str][source]

Make prediction on extracted features.

Parameters:

features – List of feature values.

Returns:

  • prediction: “Normal” or “Anomalous”

  • confidence: Probability score (0.0 to 1.0)

  • severity: Severity level (“None”, “Low”, “Medium”, “High”, “Critical”)

  • attack_type: Type of attack detected

Return type:

Tuple containing

Raises:

  • ValueError – If features are invalid.

  • Exception – If prediction fails.
